newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-BHP says shuts Papua New Guinea plant.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-BHP says shuts Papua New Guinea plant.

text.p: The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd said on Sunday it had closed its Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea, steel processing centre and evacuated some dependents due to security concerns, chief executive John Prescott said on Sunday.

"We're seeing quite a normal situation where most of our operations are concerned but in places like Port Moresby we are taking steps to protect our employees and their dependents and to generally recocognise situations occuring there," he said.
Prescott said 10 to 15 dependents of employees have or would be flown out of Port Moresby, where political turmoil resulted in looting and lawlessness earlier this week.
Prescott said all expatriate employees would be evacuated.
"If you're talking about non-nationals, we're not likely to have anyone in Port Moresby," he said.
"We're putting the security of our people and their well-being as first priority," he said.
However, Prescott said operations at the BHP-operated Ok Tedi copper/gold mine, in the remote central west of Papua New Guinea, were normal.
